definition: to climb a wall/(fig.) to be unfaithful
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up

sentences.english: They climb walls, leap off buildings and spy on enemies.
sentences.chinese: 它們會爬牆，能跳下大樓，還能暗中監視敵人。

sentences.english: I saw the boy climb the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我看見那個男孩爬牆了。

sentences.english: He tore a hole in his trousers climbing over the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他爬牆時褲子給扯破一個洞。

sentences.english: Last autumn leaves lie in the chancellorship in Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 德國，柏林，依戀在爬牆虎上的最後幾片紅葉。

sentences.english: Plant a Boston ivy beneath a great statuary.
sentences.chinese: 在一尊偉大的雕像腳下種一顆爬牆虎。

sentences.english: I saw the boy climbing the wall.
A lot of people ran away by climbing the walls.
Completely broken my dream that my dream for climbing with see the beautiful sea.
sentences.chinese: 完完全全打破了我想要在青島爬牆看海的美夢。

definition: locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to allow in fresh air/to allow a prisoner out for exercise/to give out information
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
